Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Had a really good time at the restaurant. The waitress and owner were super friendly and the food was delicious. This restaurant it’s a good “cost benefit”, you can find lunch and dinner options starting 9 euros (which for Amsterdam is super cheap) - really good pasta options! Beer was cold, delicious and fair price! I recommend it!

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Not half that bad. We ordered a 3 pizzas and 3 times pasta. Everybody was satisfied with the food. …

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Great food and the staff were super nice to us.  Good place to spend time with family, including children! I’ll come back for sure!

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Tucked Away in Rembrandt Square Cosy Little Italian   Beautiful Inside      Very Near to The Three Sisters Pub

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Waitress very friendly, waiter was NOT❗ Anti pasta was a dissapointment.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Ice creams are not good at all. Lazy and unrespectful service. We waited 15 minutes to get the bill in order to pay. Should have left without paying considering how pitifull the experience was. To be avoided even for a simple drink

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Waited for almost an hour and the food wasn’t tasty at all. The Pasta was really dry and the pizza we had was terrible. The waitress was also unfriendly.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Terrible experience. Dirty table , flies everywhere, pizza was a glorified cheese toasty and the carbonara tasted just like milk and pasta. Couldn't even finish half of our meal because it tasted so bad

Name: La Madonnina

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Good looking interior and clean. Menu is varied and not expensive, especially for the nice location at Rembrandt square. I had the vegetariana pizza and it was good. A bit quiet though on Sunday evening.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Nice and tasty pizza. Very friendly service. I recommend this place .

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text:
Tourist trap! Great location but terrible food
The tomato soup tasted kind of like ketchup. They charge you for the type of pasta you chose (e.g charged us 0.80 for choosing penne)

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Really bad service and average pizza. One of my friends got her Food 30 minutes later than the rest and they forgot the side dish pasta of my other friend. Also when we got served, the waitress broke a plate in our table and didn't even …

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Worst experience ever. Our tortellini were good but Carppacio was disgusting. The woman Who looks like if she was The Boss, was very rude with everyone.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text:
Good location, overlooking Rembrandtplein.
But the food itself was not good. The pizza was quite bland and tasteless. The servers were friendly enough, but inattentive, and it was difficult to get their attention.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Garlic bread with cheese is actually a pita with butter and basil. Horrible. Avoid at all costs.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Bland food. Terrible service. Added a lot of salt and the pizza was okay.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Looks great from inside and carbonara was perfect enough to enjoy our evening.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Reasonably nice Italian restaurant. Fairly standard as Italian restaurants go. Nice place to eat in the evening due to heated outdoor area.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: The stuff was really nice and kind. The food was good. The portion of lasagne was good but there was NO bechamel. The pizza was good as well and about the spaghetti carbonara - it had a little bit different taste than I’m used to from Italy but it was still good.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Decent place for a bite to eat and a beer. You pay a bit of a premium for eating on the square, but it's by no means expensive. Nice outdoor dining area with a few under table heaters and blankets for when it's cold. Staff were attentive and friendly.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: The decent price could not make up for the poor service. Ordered garlic cheese bread which was no longer warm when brought to the table. The waiter seemed annoyed because we had questions about what we were ordering. The food, for 4 of us, …

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Visited twice in our stay for dinner. Staff were very good, genuine in their welcome, helpful, engaging and made time for a chat, good sense of humour and excellent service. The pasta was very tasty - the best we have had outside of Italy. …

Name: La Madonnina

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Leaving a review to counter some of the negative ones on here. Just had lunch (pizza, pasta, a cheeseboard and a kid's chicken meal), the service was quick, the food was decent and reasonably priced. If you're a family looking for something quick and easy that isn't junk food, this place is fine.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text:

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: It took an hour and a half for our food to arrive for non-complex orders. The cutlery was unclean and the staff blamed the industrial dishwasher being too hot for them. Servers were rude, and several soups had things in them I'd rather not find out what. Disgusting place, barely mediocre food, and absolutely terrible service.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Pizza Quatro formaggi" - very good. Good taste of different cheeses. However waiter (lady) quie rude. Nice view.

Name: La Madonnina

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text:
Prices reasonable, food disappointing. Sadly a lot of the prime locations seem to be trading on their position rather than the quality of the food.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Not bad. Veal was a bit dry. Pizza was large, more than enough for one person. Prices were ok for restaurant location.

Review Text: I liked the food, I liked the staff despite all the negative reviews!

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Very tasty food, generous plating and decent prices make up for an overall pleasant experience if you want to grab lunch or dinner. Keep in mind that during peak hours, serving might be a bit on the slow side.

Review Text: Some of the worst service ever had. Completely forgot about us with the restaurant empty, pretty rude service as well. Way over priced for mediocre food at best. The most ridiculous part of this was that as a starter they serve IMITATION CRAB MEAT instead of  SHRIMP.

Review Text:

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Despite of the good location, this is a place to avoid. The disappointment starts with the service, the beer taste really weird and the lasagna was more like a soup of cheese.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: The food is terrible. The salad I ordered was dirty and not washed. The spaghetti pesto came with an ugly cheese sauce and was not fresh made. The table towel was not clean and service was very unprofessional. I wont eat here again!

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: The pizzas we had were tasteless and obviously made from poor ingredients. The "pasta frutti di mare" that another person in our party had, appeared to be primarily spagetti and surimi.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: We ordered food that never came but they tried to charge us for it. We got warm white wine - TWICE! The men's bathrooms had no functioning lock.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Do I really have to give it one star? This must be the worst "Restaurant" in Amsterdam. The food we ordered was killed by using most of the salt available to the chef. Bad food, bad service, bad seating (cramped and flavoured by the smells from the toilets).

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Horrible food and terrible service. Visited it with my boyfriend. They did not seem to want to serve us at all, they were very rude and ignored us on several occasions. I would say almost to the point where it felt racist, because to other people of different nationalities they were very cordial and polite.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: Sat down before reading all the negative reviews. I was by myself so didn’t need much service. The Cannelloni I had was pretty good and worth the price of 9 Euros.

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: I had the margarita pizza and a couple of heinekens, it was fantastic.

Name: La Madonnina

Name: La Madonnina

Name: La Madonnina
Review Text: 1h30 before they tell us that our order was lost between our table and the kitchen. Every time we asked them during the long wait they were like "just 5 min more and it's ready". So we just left.

Review Text: As of february 2014, the food is awful, the service is bad, and they won't give you tap water.  Make yourself a favor and buy your pre-cooked food at the supermarket, it will be the same.

Review Text: Great staff and food, Rembrandt Square is always nice. I was in Amsterdam for about a month and only ate at a few places more than once and I was there at least four times.
